One-stage design

Source: R/OneStageDesign.R, R/regularization.R
OneStageDesign-class.Rd

OneStageDesign allows the usage of a single-stage design. In this case without a second stage, there only exist the first-stage sample size n1 and the first-stage rejection boundary c1f. No other parameters have to be set. OneStageDesign is a subclass of TwoStageDesign.

OneStageDesign(n, c)

# S4 method for OneStageDesign
update(object, params, ...)

# S4 method for OneStageDesign,numeric
n2(d, x1, ...)

# S4 method for OneStageDesign,numeric
c2(d, x1, ...)

# S4 method for OneStageDesign
TwoStageDesign(d, ...)

# S4 method for OneStageDesign
plot(x, y, ...)

# S4 method for SmoothnessN2,OneStageDesign
evaluate(s, design, ...)

Arguments

n

sample size (stage-one sample size)
c

rejection boundary (c = c1f = c1e)
object

object to update
params

vector of design parameters (must be in same order as returned by as.numeric(OneStageDesign))
...

further optional arguments
d

object of class OneStageDesign
x1

stage-one outcome
x

not used
y

not used
s

an object of class SmoothnessN2
design

an object of class OneStageDesign

Slots

n1

sample size

c1f

rejection boundary

c1e

rejection boundary

n2_pivots

constant 0

c2_pivots

+/- Inf

x1_norm_pivots

is ignored for OneStageDesign

weights

is ignored for OneStageDesign

tunable

is ignored for OneStageDesign

Contents

  • Arguments
  • Slots
